Reports.Value:
Click on the report groups to show the available reports.

Long reports, or reports which are to be formatted for printing, can be displayed in a separate window. To display a report in a separate window click the Show this report in a new window link.

ReportClass.Value: Booking reports provide information about online orders. Consignment reports provide information about deliveries.

Report.Value:
The Booking History report shows details of online orders made within a selected period.

Select the report period required by specifying the start and end date in the format shown.

Click the calendar icon or use the date dropdown boxes to select the report dates.

Click generate report to retrieve data. Sort displayed data by clicking on column headers.

Click re-select report filter to change the reporting period.

The Item Booking History report shows each item in each online order made within a selected period.

Select the report period required by specifying the start and end date in the format shown.

Click the calendar icon or use the date dropdown boxes to select the report dates.

Click generate report to retrieve data. Sort displayed data by clicking on column headers.

Click re-select report filter to change the reporting period.

The Consignments by Consignee report shows product deliveries within a selected period grouped by Consignee.

Select the report period required by specifying the start and end date from the dropdown boxes, then click the Run button.

The Consignment Cost report shows the total value of each consignment within a selected period.

Select the report period required by specifying the start and end date in the format shown.

Click the calendar icon or use the date dropdown boxes to select the report dates.

Click generate report to retrieve data. Click the Information button to display details of an individual consignment. Sort displayed data by clicking on column headers.

Click re-select report filter to change the reporting period.

The Cancelled Bookings report shows all bookings that were cancelled prior to delivery.

Select the report period required by specifying the start and end date in the format shown.

Click the calendar icon or use the date dropdown boxes to select the report dates.

Click generate report to retrieve data. Click the Information button to display details of an individual consignment. Sort displayed data by clicking on column headers.

Click re-select report filter to change the reporting period.

ReportClass.Value: Product reports provide information about the products that are available to order.

Report.Value:
The Product History report lists all products and displays the activity recorded for a selected product.

List all products or search product descriptions to display a list of matching products. Click column headers to sort the list.

Click export product list to excel to export a list of products to Excel.
Report.Tooltip: Click to display the Product History Report

Report.Value:
The Product Usage Report lists, for each product, the number of items that have been despatched during the selected period.

Select the report period required by specifying the start and end date in the format shown.

Click the calendar icon or use the date dropdown boxes to select the report dates.

Click generate report to retrieve data. Sort displayed data by clicking on column headers.

Click re-select report filter to change the reporting period.
Report.Tooltip: Click to display the Product Usage Report

Report.Value:
The Product Value Report lists, for each product, the number of items in stock and, where applicable, their monetary value. Archived products are not reported.

Click show all products to list all products, or use the search box to display a list of products with matching descriptions. Click column headers to sort the list.
Report.Tooltip: Click to display the Product Value Report

Report.Value: The Pallet Usage report shows monthly pallet usage.

ReportClass.Value: Authorisation reports are applicable only if you have the Product or Order Authorisation feature enabled. These reports provide information on the status and configuration of Authorisation.

Report.Value:
The Authorisable Products Report lists, for each product, whether it requires authorisation, ie whether the 'Requires Auth' check box is ticked.

To display this report, select Authorisable Products from the Custom Reports drop down box.

The Authorisations In Force report shows the authorisations that have been granted to each user for each product. Note that Authorisations that have exceeded their duration are automatically revoked and are no longer shown.

To display this report, select Authorisations In Force from the Custom Reports drop down box.

Report.Value:
To display a list of system users use the Custom Reports facility, selecting System Users as the data source.

Click on Custom Reports for further information.

To display the contents of the Shared Address Book select Shared Address Book from the list of tables

Click on Custom Reports for further information.

ReportClass.Value:
The custom reports facility provides data download to comma-separated variable (CSV) files, a data format suitable for display and manipulation using widely available productivity tools such as Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word and Microsoft Access, or for transfer to in-house management information systems.

Using Microsoft Excel, data can be sorted, formatted and charted for production of comprehensive management reports.

To format data using Microsoft Word, save the file with a .doc extension, select the imported data, then place it in a table (Table | Convert | Text to Table). Word may prompt you to install the text import converter if this is not already installed. If so you may need the original Microsoft Office CD.

Report.Value:
Select the report you require. The reports are grouped by topic area, eg - ADDRESS BOOK REPORTS -. A description of the content of the report is shown together with a list of available data fields.

Use the Select All or Clear All links, or click individual tick boxes in the Select Data Fields list, to select the data items to be displayed. The field descriptions indicate the purpose of each field and any related fields.

The Return 10 items max. tick box limits the amount of data retrieved to a maximum of 10 items, useful when you wish to explore the content of different reports. The Include field names tick box inserts a list of field names in the top row.

Use the option buttons to select whether to display the report in Microsoft Excel (the default), in Microsoft Word, or as a plain text document.
